info.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
info.writers: George Lucas Philip Kaufman Menno Meyjes Jeffrey Boam

beginning.s: INDIANA JONES AND THE LAST CRUSADE

scene.sceneheader: EXT. DESERT OF THE AMERICAN SOUTHWEST - DAY

meta.s: A mountain peak dominates the landscape.
TITLES BEGIN.
Riders on horseback cross the desert.
From this distance they appear to be a company of Army Cavalry Soldiers.

dialogue.name: CLOSER ANGLES ON THE RIDERS
dialogue.s: reveal only details of saddles, hooves and uniforms.
The riders are silhouetted against the rising sun as they ride into an ancient CLIFF PUEBLO.

meta.s: The OFFICER IN COMMAND raises his hand halting his troops.
RIDERS climb down from their mounts... and only now do we realize that this is a TROOP OF BOY SCOUTS, all of them about thirteen years of age.
The "Commanding Officer" is only their SCOUTMASTER, Mr. Havelock.
One of the Scouts, a pudgy kid named HERMAN, steps away from his horse, bends over and pukes.
The other Scouts rag on him.
A BLOND SCOUT, however, befriends Herman.
He has a thatch of straw-colored hair and the no-nonsense expression common to kids whose curiosity and appetite for knowledge exceed what they teach in school.
Additionally, he has adorned his uniform with an authentic HOPI INDIAN WOVEN BELT.

dialogue.name: SCOUTMASTER
dialogue.s: Some of the passageways in here can run for miles.

meta.s: Two Boy Scouts climb up the rocky base of the cliff.
The two boys head down the passageway.
It's dark, and the temperature drops several degrees.
Spiders have built huge webs that get caught in the boys' hair.
HERMAN appears very uncertain as to the wisdom of this enterprise, but he's drawn on by his companion's adventurous curiosity.
CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: HERMAN
dialogue.s: I don't think this is such a good idea.

meta.s: LAUGHTER is HEARD; the Blond Scout pulls Herman forward toward its source.
The VOICES GROW LOUDER now as the boys get closer to their source.
The light of kerosene lanterns dances on the tunnel walls ahead.
The boys approach cautiously, careful to stay hidden.
This is what they see: FOUR MEN digging with shovels and pick-axes.
They have broken into one of the pueblo's SECRET CHAMBERS... called "Kivas."
The men are ROUGH RIDER (his name describes his dress), ROSCOE (a Bowery Boy bully of 14) and HALFBREED (with straight black hair that cascades over his shoulders).
And the fourth man wears a LEATHER WAIST JACKET and BROWN FELT FEDORA HAT.
He has his back turned to us, but we would be willing to bet anything that this is INDLANA JONES.
However, when the man turns, and his face is illuminated by the lantern's glow, we are shocked to discover that it is someone else.
We'll call him FEDORA.
TITLES END.
The TWO BOYS are mesmerized by what they see.
Now we realize that the Blond Scout is actually young INDIANA JONES.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: Alfred, did you get anything yet?

meta.s: Two of the men stand and look at ROSCOE who steps forward holding a box in his hands.
Whoops from the other men.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED: (2)
dialogue.s: ROSCOE rushes forward and gives FEDORA the box.
Fedora steps toward a lantern resting on a rock.

meta.s: More whoops from the other men.
FEDORA puts the box on the rock next to the lantern.
HALFBREED pushes ROSCOE as he jumps with excitement.
ROUGH RIDER steps forward to look at the box as Fedora opens it.

dialogue.name: ROSCOE
dialogue.s: (more whoops; then) Oh, look at thatl (more whoops) We're richl We're rich!

meta.s: FEDORA takes a BEJEWELED CROSS from the box and holds it aloft.
Fedora's comrades practically salivate at the sight of it.
INDY takes off his hat and looks down at the o.s.
action.
FEDORA blows dust from the Cross, turning it in his hand, silently appraising its beauty... and its value.
He seems aloof from the others; somehow superior to them.

dialogue.name: HALFBREED
dialogue.s: Hey, we got to find more stuff to bring back.

meta.s: INDY stays hidden, but is astounded by what he sees.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (hushed; urgent) It's the Cross of Coronadol Cortes gave it to him in 15201

dialogue.name: CONTINUED: (3)
dialogue.s: FEDORA continues to admire the Cross, then places it on the rock next to its box and the lantern.

meta.s: INDY turns back to observe the men.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: That Cross is an important artifact.

meta.s: A look of resolve comes into INDY's expression, and he turns back toward HERMAN.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Run back and find the others.
Tell Mister Havelock that there are men looting in the caves.

meta.s: HERMAN doesn't seem to be listening.
Instead, he watches in wide-eyed horror as a SNAKE SLITHERS ACROSS HIS LAP.
INDY matter-of-factly picks up the snake and tosses it aside.
HERMAN gasps.
INDY grabs HERMAN's scout scarf and pulls him closer.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Did you hear what I said?

dialogue.name: HERMAN
dialogue.s: What, what are you gonna do?

meta.s: INDY releases the scarf, gives HERMAN a pat and Herman dashes off.
Indy sees the Cross on the rock next to the lantern.
As the Robbers continue to search for additional valuables, Indy is able to work his way unseen to within arm's reach of the Cross... FEDORA looks over at the men digging in a hole b.g.
INDY picks up the Cross.
CONTINUED: (4)
As FEDORA stands watching the other men digging, INDY puts the Cross in his pants and begins to pull himself up a rope hanging nearby.
As he climbs, Indy's feet break a wooden beam, attracting the men's attention.
The three Robbers are so eager to get their hands on INDY, they almost knock each other over in the attempt.
Only FEDORA is unperturbed.
He casts a disgusted glance in the direction of his fleeing companions and then sets off after INDY.
INDY EMERGES from the darkness of the Pueblo into the brightness of day.
He pauses and squints and shields his eyes and looks in all directions.
He hears RUNNING FOOTSTEPS BEHIND HIM and dashes off.
ROUGH RIDER, HALFBREED, and ROSCOE are quick to appear and run after him.
Indy jumps from one rock to another; the SCOUT TROOP HORSES are below.
Indy puts two fingers in his mouth and WHISTLES for his horse, who trots over.
Indy puts the Cross in his belt.
INDY PREPARES TO JUMP into the saddle.
Hesitates.
Then... he JUMPS.
But the horse moves exactly at the wrong moment and Indy lands flat on his feet in a standing position.
The impact sends a shock wave up his body that rattles his back teeth.
Indy stands up and successfully mounts his horse.
FEDORA AND HIS MEN ARRIVE at the roof's edge in time to see INDY climb into the saddle and gallop off.
CONTINUED:
FEDORA puts two fingers in his mouth and WHISTLES... and A VINTAGE TRUCK AND AUTOMOBILE come ROARING OUT from behind the Pueblo (Driven by two more gang members).
Now we glimpse...

dialogue.name: THE MAN IN THE PANAMA HAT
dialogue.s: His face is concealed by the hat's wide brim.
His arm is out the window, however, and we see an olive-colored hand protruding from the sleeve of an expensive white linen suit.
He gestures to the Robbers, now in the truck.

meta.s: INDY SPURS his mount on to greater speeds but the autos not only keep pace with his horse... they begin to squeeze in on it.
Speeding Autos.
Thundering hooves.
Rushing wind.
Flying dust.
INDY crouched low and leaning forward in the saddle, his heart pounding, his adrenalin pumping.
INDY VEERS OFF in a new direction and toward a RAILROAD TRACK.
The train is barreling down the track.
INDY rides up beside it.
He glances over his shoulder and sees the car and truck gaining on him.
No other choice... he LEAPS FROM HORSE TO TRAIN.
He clings to the side of a BOXCAR, as HALFBREED and ROUGH RIDER leap from the truck onto the train.
HALFBREED tries to grab INDY, but Indy leaps onto another boxcar.
Halfbreed runs after him but Indy leaps from the boxcar onto some covered boxes stacked on a flatcar.
INDY loses his balance but regains it.
With HALFBREED and ROUGH RIDER still running after him, Indy enters the trap door of...
and finds himself CRAWLING on a CATWALK suspended from the car's ceiling.
Several feet below are NUMEROUS VATS containing all manner of reptiles: Alligators, crocodiles, giant lizards, etc.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: Then, HALFBREED ENTERS through the trap door and followed by ROUGH RIDER.
Halfbreed grabs hold of INDY's feet, but Indy kicks at him and he loses his grasp.

meta.s: INDY crawls away, toward an opening on the opposite side.
HALFBREED grabs at Indy's feet again; Indy rolls away and we SEE large bins of squirming snakes.
The combined weight of the three people is more than the catwalk was intended for, and the BOLTS BEGIN TO RIP FROM THE CEILING.
Everyone holds their breath, afraid to make another move.
Too late.
SEVERAL BOLTS TEAR FREE.
HALFBREED and ROUGH RIDER SCREAM... but it's Indy's end of the catwalk that DROPS DOWN...
PLUNGING INDY to the floor of the car.
He lands hard, with a SPLASH into a vat of water... where he finds himself eye- to-eye with an and

dialogue.name: ENORMOUS ANACONDA
dialogue.s: The head of this snake is so damn big, it looks more like a Tyrannosaurus Rex.

meta.s: INDY jumps back in horror... only to land with a SQUISH into the SNAKE VAT.
Hundreds of slippery, squirming snakes.
INDY sinks into them.
They cover him.
Engulf him.
Almost smother him.
INDY jumps out of the side of the vat, freeing himself.
INDY locates a clean-out door at the bottom of the car and uses it to escape.
HALFBREED, meanwhile, tries to open the closed window of the car.
He groans.
ROUGH RIDER moves to assist him.
INDY stops, checks to see the Cross still lodged in his belt.
Suddenly he looks worried as he frantically reaches into his shirt, REMOVES A SNAKE FROM and tosses it away.
ROSCOE APPEARS atop the reptile car and manages to grab INDY.
Indy kicks at him.
Roscoe grabs onto the side of the reptile car as Indy moves on to...
INDY climbs over canvas-covered circus equipment.
ROSCOE follows, grabbing a long stick with a hook on it.
He reaches forward and trips Indy, who falls onto the roof of the rhino boxcar.
as a lamp falls from the ceiling with the impact of Indy's fall, hitting a HUGE BLACK RHINOCEROS.
ROSCOE grabs INDY by the ankle and yanks him off his feet.
The two struggle, rolling from side to side, coming perilously close to rolling right off the edge.
Things get even more serious when Roscoe PULLS A KNIFE.

dialogue.name: IN THE BOXCAR BELOW
dialogue.s: THE FEROCIOUS BLACK RHINO is becoming extremely agitated by the commotion going on atop his cage.
Finally, he raises his head and THRUSTS HIS HORN THROUGH THE ROOF.

dialogue.name: BACK TO THE ROOFTOP
dialogue.s: as the horn SMASHES through the wood only inches from INDY's head.
Indy and Roscoe stare at the horn in amazement as they continue to struggle.
The horn comes up again and RIGHT BETWEEN INDY'S LEGS.

meta.s: INDY kicks ROSCOE away.
Roscoe rolls to the edge of the car but keeps from falling.
Indy flips over onto his stomach.
The WOODEN TRAP DOOR EXPLODES as a BULLET is FIRED from within.
The door is pushed open and HALFBREED and ROUGH RIDER hurry out of the car.
INDY gets to his feet and looks ahead and sees a WATER TANK alongside the track directly up ahead.
Indy gets an idea...
In an instant, he calculates his approach and times the distance and and LEAPS for the tank's WATER SPOUT.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: He catches it perfectly... but his velocity causes the water spout to ROTATE A FULL 360 DEGREES.
With INDY hanging on, feet kicking, the water spout deposits him back on the train, onto the ROOF OF A STOCKCAR, where he looks up to see FEDORA walking toward him.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: There's no way out of this.

meta.s: As INDY edges away from FEDORA, a portion of the STOCKCAR'S ROOF COLLAPSES and Indy FALLS THROUGH into the car below.
INDY CRASHES down from above.
Dust rises.
INDY's eyes take a moment to adjust to the dark.
A bit of sunlight leaks in through the cracks between the boards.
Then INDY sees it.
At the far end of the boxcar.
Rising slowly to its feet... an AFRICAN LION.
The Lion ROARS.
The boxcar walls shake.
Indy gasps.
Dust swirls up into the shafts of sunlight.
And INDY has one more surprise in store: The Cross of Cortes has been dislodged from his belt during the fall... INDY glances around, sees a coiled LION TAMER'S WHIP hanging on a nail.
He carefully takes it down by the handle.
The Lion sees this and GROWLS SOFTLY.
INDY swallows hard and gives the whip a try.
It unravels awkwardly, its TIP flying back and HITTING INDY IN THE FACE...
CUTTING his chin.
The Lion GROWLS LOUDER.
Indy quickly gathers up the whip, wets his lips, and tries again.
This time and success!
The WHIP CRACKS SHARPLY.
The Lion BELLOWS and SWATS the air... and steps back.
INDY looks amazed and delighted.
He CRACKS the whip again.
The Lion backs away even more.
Indy inches forward and bends down (never taking his eyes off the Lion) and picks up the Cross and and steps back again, sweat pouring down his face.
But now... how to get out?
He looks up at the opening through which he fell and sees FEDORA LOOKING DOWN AT HIM.
Fedora extends his hand.
FEDORA, assisted by HALFBREED and ROUGH RIDER, "reels" INDY out of the Stockcar as the Lion ROARS and lunges and Indy screams.
The men, including ROSCOE, pull INDY through the hole in the roof.
He stands to face them as ROUGH RIDER points a gun in his direction.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: (indicates Cross) But that belongs to me.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (takes Cross from his belt) It belongs to Coronado.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: And so are all his grandchildren.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: This should be in a museum.

meta.s: ROSCOE makes a grab for the Cross and but INDY doesn't let go.
A tug-of-war ensues until a SNAKE WIGGLES OUT FROM INDY'S SHIRTSLEEVE and WRAPS AROUND Roscoe's hand.
ROSCOE SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER and releases his grip on the Cross and tries to shake off the snake.
This is all the opportunity Indy needs.
He LEAPS ONTO THE NEXT CAR.
INDY swings down to the caboose.
He sees a sign above the caboose door reading "DR. FANTASY'S MAGIC CABOOSE."
He glances back at the men and quickly opens the door to the caboose, stepping inside.
FEDORA puts out his arm, gesturing for the others not to follow INDY.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: Make sure he doesn't double back.

meta.s: which contains the circus MAGIC EQUIPMENT.
INDY rushes to the rear door of the caboose but can't open it.
He hears FEDORA coming, and dives into a MAGIC BOX.
FEDORA smiles confidently and advances toward the box.
The box unexpectedly collapses; all four sides flop away... revealing NOTHING.
INDY has completely vanished.
FEDORA is mystified, frustrated and angered.
Then he feels a breeze at his back.
He turns and discovers that the caboose door is open.
He rushes out onto the balcony and sees: INDY RUNNING along the tracks, turning up a street of modest clapboard houses.
as INDY runs from the railroad tracks and approaches his house we see the name "JONES" painted on the mailbox.
INDY bursts through the front door holding the Cross in his hand.
A Husky BARKS as Indy runs past in search of his father.
INDY charges in.
The study is cluttered with books.
Pictures, charts and maps clearly reflect the father's passion for Medieval studies.
PROFESSOR HENRY JONES is absorbed at his desk.
In fact, he is studying a very ancient parchment volume which lies open on the desk.
The page shows a beautifully illuminated picture of what might be a stained-glass window.
The sketch incorporates a series of Roman numerals.
The Professor is not just studying it, he is copying it into his own notebook.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: We never get to see the PROFESSOR's face in this scene.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Then wait and count to twenty.

meta.s: No question who is the boss here.
INDY gulps, his look says "What am I going to do with this guy?"
And obeys and starts counting, VERY, VERY FAINTLY.
Now we see what HENRY is concentrating on.
We see his hand sketching; then, he holds up one finger.
INDY's reaction:

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (louder, in Greek) One... two... three... four...

meta.s: An ancient car is heard arriving.
Perhaps INDY glimpses it going past the window.
Anyway, it stops outside the house.
Two men sit in the front seat.
HERMAN sits in the rear, BLOWING A TRUMPET.
INDY's reaction: Trouble!
HENRY is just finishing the sketch.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: May he who illuminated this... illuminate me...

meta.s: The study door is just closing, INDY closing it behind him... just as HERMAN comes through the front door, still playing the trumpet.
INDY reaches for the trumpet, pulling it from HERMAN's mouth.
Herman continues to spit and right into Indy's face.
Indy flinches.
HERMAN means the SHERIFF, who now enters the house.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Just the man I want to see!
Now, there were five or six of them.

meta.s: INDY shows the CROSS, more or less handing it to the SHERIFF to make his point.
The Sheriff takes it casually.

dialogue.name: SHERIFF
dialogue.s: I'm glad to see that... because the rightful owner of this Cross won't press charges, if you give it back.

meta.s: FEDORA enters the house, followed by ROSCOE, ROUGH RIDER and HALFBREED.
He politely removes his hat and holds it in his hand.
He nods at INDY in a friendly manner.

dialogue.name: SHERIFF
dialogue.s: He's got witnesses, five or six of them.

meta.s: The SHERIFF and FEDORA are in Cahoots The SHERIFF hands the Cross to FEDORA.
ROSCOE reaches in and takes it from Fedora, then runs out the door.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: As ROSCOE runs outside INDY sees and through the screen door and the MAN IN THE PANAMA HAT waiting patiently beside the car that is parked out front.
Roscoe approaches and gives the Man the Cross and the Man hands Roscoe some money in exchange.

meta.s: The SHERIFF tips his hat and leaves.
FEDORA remains behind for a moment.
He turns and speaks to INDY in an ironic man-to-man way.

dialogue.name: FEDORA
dialogue.s: You lost today, kid, but that doesn't mean you have to like it.

meta.s: Then, FEDORA takes off his hat and takes a step towards INDY.
He holds the hat by the crown, and puts it on Indy's head, a show of respect and admiration for the boy.
The hat blocks Indy's face.

dialogue.name: CLOSE ON THE TOP OF THE FEDORA HAT
dialogue.s: The hat brim fills the screen.
As the brim tilts up, WE SEE the face of FULL GROWN INDIANA JONES.

meta.s: And...
POW!...
he's punched in the face while his arms are pinned behind his back.
TITLE: "PORTUGUESE COAST and 1938"

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Too small for two of us.

meta.s: THE MAN IN THE PANAMA HAT (years older now) removes the CROSS OF CORONADO from Indy's belt.

dialogue.name: PANAMA HAT
dialogue.s: This is the second time I've had to reclaim my property from you and

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: That belongs in a museum and

dialogue.name: PANAMA HAT
dialogue.s: (he moves his eyeline) Throw him over the side.

dialogue.name: THE DECK OF A PORTUGUESE CARGO SHIP
dialogue.s: We're in the middle of a violent STORM AT SEA.
Thirty-foot waves crash across the deck.

meta.s: The TWO PORTUGUESE SAILORS (who have Indy's arms pinned behind his back) propel INDY across the deck toward the rail.
As they pass a BUNDLE OF FUEL DRUMS, INDY uses the Two Sailors as leverage to KICK UP HIS FEET and break open the CLAMP on the metal bands that hold the drums together.
INDY jabs his elbows into the stomachs of the startled Sailors and rushes toward the MAN IN THE PANAMA HAT.
PANAMA HAT sees INDY coming and hurries toward the ladder that leads up to the bridge.
Indy withstands the force of waves crashing on the deck and makes his way to where Panama Hat is climbing the ladder.
He pulls him off the ladder from behind the two men fall down on the deck.
Indy takes the cross back from Panama Hat.
A sailor delivers a powerful blow to Indy's face, sending the cross flying out of his grip and skittering across the deck.
Indy grabs a crowbar and fends off two sailors who attack him from the sides.
INDY sees that the Cross is about to be swept overboard.
He lunges for it.
He SNATCHES UP the Cross only to be knocked down to the deck by a giant wave.
He struggles to his feet, managing to avoid the giant fuel drums sliding across the deck around him.
SEVERAL MORE DRUMS come INDY's way.
He sidesteps them all.
Indy turns around and pummels two sailors with one punch.
Indy sees a large Stevedore's hook above him and he climbs up on crates to reach it.
He grabs a hold of the hook and uses it to swing all the way across the deck, narrowly avoiding a huge wave behind him.
He jumps into the rollicking ocean, still holding onto the cross.
On the ship, a giant fuel drum rolls wildly, falling directly onto a crate of TNT.
The crate explodes, causing the entire ship to blow, sending an enormous orange fireball into the sky.

dialogue.name: LONG SHOT - THE BOAT EXPLODING OUT OF THE WATER
dialogue.s: as bits of debris fall from the sky like rain.

dialogue.name: INDY BOBS UP
dialogue.s: in the water amid the debris, holding the Cross in his hand.
He grabs for something to keep him afloat.
It turns out to be one of the ship's LIFE PRESERVERS.
INDY loops his arm through the preserver.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: Only now do we see the FADED LETTERING on the preserver revealing the destroyed ship's name and city of port:

meta.s: VAZQUEZ de CORONADO

dialogue.name: BARCELONA
dialogue.s: A SHREDDED PANAMA HAT floats past.

meta.s: INDY, dressed in professorial tweeds, stands before his class.
He turns to the blackboard with a piece of chalk and writes the word: "FACT."

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: If it's truth you're interested in, Doctor Tyree's Philosophy class is right down the hall.

meta.s: Laughter.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: So forget any ideas you've got about lost cities, exotic travel, and digging up the world.
Eve do not follow maps to buried treasure and "X" never, ever, marks the spot.

meta.s: MARCUS BRODY approaches Indy's classroom.
He peers through the window in the door to see INDY completing his lecture.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Seventy percent of all archaeology is done in the library.

meta.s: BRODY enters the lecture hall and stands at the rear of the room.
CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: We cannot afford to take mythology at face value.

meta.s: The BELL RINGS.
INDY stands at his desk as students begin to disperse.
A pretty coed puts a note on the desk.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Starting with the excavation of Naukratis by Blinders Petrie in 1885.
I will be in my office if anybody's got any problems for the next hour and a half.

meta.s: BRODY approaches as the last of the students leaves the lecture hall.
INDY removes the cloth-wrapped Cross from his desk.
He places it on the desk and takes off his glasses as BRODY examines the Cross.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: You know how long I've been looking for that?

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Very well done, indeed This will find a place of honor in our Spanish collection.

meta.s: INDY gathers up his books and makes his way toward the door.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: We can discuss my honorarium over dinner and champagne tonight.

meta.s: He turns back toward BRODY, now holding the Cross.
Bursting with STUDENTS, all competing for his attention at once: "Professor Jones! "
"Doctor Jonesl " etc., etc.
INDY shoulders his way to the desk of his secretary, an overwhelmed Teaching Assistant named IRENE.

dialogue.name: IRENE
dialogue.s: Your mail is on your desk.

dialogue.name: IRENE
dialogue.s: And these term papers still haven't been graded.

meta.s: INDY takes the term papers then turns to enter his PRIVATE OFFICE.
Students once again CLAMOR for his attention: "Doctor Jones!"
"Wait, Doctor Jonesl" "My grade!"
"Sign my registration card!"
INDY silences the mob with a raised hand.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Irene, put everyone's name on a list, in the order they arrived, and I'll see each and every one of them in turn.

meta.s: The Students descend upon poor IRENE, each claiming to be first.
INDY slips into his -

dialogue.name: PRIVATE OFFICE
dialogue.s: where he goes to his desk and finds a thick envelope with a foreign postmark on it.

meta.s: Then, INDY stuffs his mail into his coat pockets, goes to the WINDOW, slides it open and STEPS OUT INTO THE GARDEN.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. SIDE OF COLLEGE BUILDING - DAY

meta.s: INDY escapes through the garden.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. FRONT OF COLLEGE BUILDING - DAY

meta.s: INDY walks briskly toward the street; smiling, erUoying his freedom.
As he arrives at the curb, a LONG BLACK PACKARD SEDAN pulls up before him.
THREE MEN step out of the sedan.
Everything about them bespeaks "G-MAN."
The First Man steps behind Indy.
INDY is ushered into a large Art Deco apartment and left alone.
Numerous museum-quality artifacts are displayed around the room.
Indy takes this opportunity to examine them.
After a moment, WALTER DONOVAN enters from across the room.
During the brief time that the door is open, we HEAR a COCKTAIL PARTY going on in the next room: VOICES and SOFT PIANO MUSIC.
DONOVAN strides across the room toward INDY.
Although in his late fifties, Donovan has the broad shoulders and trim physique of a much younger man.
Dressed in a tuxedo, he exudes both confidence and power.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: I trust your trip down was comfortable, Doctor Jones.
My men didn't alarm you, I hope.

meta.s: He shakes hands with INDY.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I know who you are Mr. Donovan.
Your contributions to the museum over the years have been extremely generous.
Some of the pieces in your collection here are very impressive.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Well, like yourself, Doctor Jones, I have a passion for antiquities.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: DONOVAN goes to a table where an object is wrapped in cloth.
He throws back the cloth revealing a flat STONE TABLET and about two feet square, inscribed with letters and symbols.

meta.s: INDY looks impressed.
He puts on his glasses to make a closer examination.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Mid- Twelfth Century, I should think.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: That was our assessment as well.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: My engineers unearthed it in the mountain region north of Ankara while excavating for copper.

meta.s: Translating the inscription is no easy matter, even for someone as knowledgeable as INDY.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (stumbling through it) "... who drinks the water I shall give him, says the Lord, will have a spring inside him welling up for eternal life.
Let them bring me to your holy mountain in the place where you dwell.

meta.s: Donovan pours champagne into several fluted glasses as Indy reads.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon, to the Temple where the cup that and "

meta.s: Suddenly INDY stops and looks up at DONOVAN with a startled expression.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: "Where the cup that holds the blood of Jesus Christ resides forever. "

meta.s: (CONT'D)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: The chalice used by Christ during the Last Supper.
The cup that caught His blood at the Crucifixion and was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea.

meta.s: INDY rubs his chin with a dubious expression as he takes the glass of champagne DONOVAN now offers him.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I've heard this bedtime story before.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: The gift of youth to whoever drinks from the Grail.
(beat) Oh, now that's a bedtime story I'd like to wake up to!

meta.s: INDY stiffens slightly at the mention of his father, nods.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: He's a teacher of Medieval Literature.
The one the students hope they don't get.

meta.s: The door opens and MRS. DONOVAN steps into the room.
She's a matronly woman in an expensive evening gown.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Be along in a moment, dear.

meta.s: He leans over and kisses her cheek.
MRS. DONOVAN sighs to herself and returns to the party.
INDY, meanwhile, has turned his attention back to the Grail Tablet, obviously hooked by its archaeological promise.
He moistens his finger with champagne and rubs it over the tablet.
DONOVAN steps up next to Indy.
CONTINUED: (3)

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: The Holy Grail's final resting place described in detail!

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: This Grail Tablet speaks of deserts and mountains and canyons.
Maybe if the Tablet were intact, you'd have something to go on.
But the entire top portion is missing.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Just the same, an attempt to recover the Grail is currently underway.

meta.s: INDY has to shake his head at DONOVAN's apparent lack of judgment.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Let me tell you another "bedtime story, " Doctor Jones.
After the Grail was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea, it disappeared and was lost for a thousand years before it was found again by three Knights of the First Crusade.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I've heard this one as well.
Two of these brothers walked out of the desert one hundred and fifty years after having found the Grail and began the long journey back to France.
But only one of them made it.
And before dying of extreme old age, he supposedly imparted his tale to a and to a Franciscan friar, I think.

meta.s: DONOVAN produces an ANCIENT LEATHER-BOUND VOLUME with very brittle pages.
INDY views the manuscript with considerable interest.
CONTINUED: (4)

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: This is the manuscript in which the friar chronicled the Knight's story... it doesn't reveal on location of the Grail, I'm afraid... but the Knight promised that two "markers" that had been left behind would.
(indicates the Tablet) This Tablet is one of those "markers."
It proves the Knight's story is true.
But as you pointed out and it's incomplete.
(beat) Now, the second "marker" is entombed with the Knight's dead brother.
Our project leader believes that tomb to be located within the city of Venice, Italy.
(beat) As you can now see, Doctor Jones, we're about to complete a great quest that began almost two thousand years ago.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: That's usually when the ground falls out from underneath your feet.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: You could be more right than you know.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Uh, we received a cable from his colleague, Doctor Schneider, who has no idea of his whereabouts or what's become of him.
(beat) I want you to pick up the trail where he left off.
Find the man and you will find the Grail.

meta.s: CONTINUED: (5)

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: You've got the wrong Jones, Mister Donovan.
Why don't you try my father?

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Your father is the man who's disappeared.

meta.s: A FORD COUPE speeds down the tree-lined street.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. PROFESSOR HENRY JONES' HOUSE - DAY

meta.s: The Ford coupe pulls up in front of the house.
INDY climbs from the car and hurries up the walkway.
BRODY is a step behind.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Your father and I have been friends since time began.
I've watched you grow up, Indy.
And I've watched the two of you grow apart.
(beat) I've never seen you this concerned about him before.

meta.s: They climb the porch and notice that the front door is ajar.
They exchange a quick look of concern as they enter.
INDY approaches the half-open front door.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (to BRODY) He's an academic A bookworm.

meta.s: He pushes open the door.
He enters the house and calls out.
INDY opens one half of the curtains dividing the hall from the sitting room.
We see the place has been ransacked.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: BRODY sees INDY's face and opens the other half.

meta.s: They walk into the room.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: What has the old fool got himself into now?

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: But whatever it is, he's in over his head!

meta.s: BRODY picks up some mail from Henry's cluttered desk.
INDY turns and sees the pile of torn papers and envelopes.
Then something hits him.
He immediately empties his pockets of his own mail taken earlier in the day from his college office and finds the envelope with the Venice postmark.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (as he tears it open) Venice, Italy!

meta.s: INDY uncovers a small book.
It looks like a JOURNAL or DIARY.
Indy flips through it: Page after page of handwritten notes and drawings.
BRODY glances at it with great curiosity.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: A complete record of his search for the Holy Grail.
Why would he have sent this to me?

meta.s: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: But someone must want it pretty badly.

meta.s: As INDY asks the question, he turns to a PAINTING on the wall: A depiction of Christ on the Cross, his blood being captured in a golden chalice.
A SECOND PAINTING on the wall shows Eleventh Century Crusaders plummeting to their deaths over a high cliff.
One Crusader, however, floats safely in midair because he holds the Grail in his hands.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Do you believe the Grail actually exists?

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: The search for the Cup of Christ is the search for the divine in all of us.

meta.s: BRODY sees that INDY is unsatisfied by this response.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: But if you want facts, Indy, I have none to give you.
At my age, I'm prepared to take a few things on faith.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Tell him I'll take that ticket to Venice now.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: I'll tell him we'll take two.

meta.s: A LIMO is parked beside a PRIVATE AIRLINER that bears the DONOVAN CORPORATE LOGO.
BRODY peers inside to DONOVAN and INDY.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Tell me, what's going to happen when we get to Venice?

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Doctor Schneider will be there to meet you.

meta.s: CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: (overlapping) I maintain an apartment in Venice, at your disposal.

meta.s: BRODY and DONOVAN shake hands.
INDY steps from the back seat of the limo.
He turns back to Donovan and shakes his hand.
INDY opens the Grail Diary and thoughtfully turns through the pages.
He stops at one page and glances at a PENCIL SKETCH of what might be a stained-glass window.
Below the sketch is a SERIES OF NUMBERS.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. THE PRIVATE AIRLINER - FLYING - DAY

meta.s: SUPERIMPOSED over a MAP that traces a course from New York City to Venice, Italy.
INDY and BRODY disembark from the Water Bus onto the Boat Landing as other Gondoliers steer their boats in the water.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Uh, how will we recognize this Doctor Schneider when we see him?

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: Suddenly a WOMAN comes up to him.
Eyes that are bright and intelligent.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: I knew it was you and

meta.s: She looks at him with an appraising expression that is brazenly flirtatious.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: and you have your father's eyes.

meta.s: INDY is instantly attracted to her.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: But the rest belongs to you.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: Looks like the best parts have already been spoken for.

meta.s: INDY grins, enjoying the repartee.
The WOMAN turns to BRODY, who tips his hat.
The Woman, DR. ELSA SCHNEIDER, extends her hand to BRODY.
INDY's grin fades.
BRODY registers a look of surprise.
INDY, BRODY and ELSA walk along the narrow canal, lined with buildings on either side.
CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: The last time I saw your father we were in the library.
He was very close to tracking down the Knight's Tomb.
I've never seen him so excited.
He was as giddy as a schoolboy.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: He was never giddy, even when he was a schoolboy!

meta.s: INDY can't take his eyes off ELSA.
Perhaps he's feeling a bit like a schoolboy himself right now.
As they cross over a bridge to the opposite side of the canal, Indy steals a flower from a street vendor.
He holds it out to Elsa.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Fraulein and will you permit me?

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: In that case, I permit you.

meta.s: INDY gives her the flower.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: It would make me very happy.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: But I'm already sad and by tomorrow it will have faded.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: (cutting in) I hate to interrupt you and but the reason we're here and

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: I have something to show you.

meta.s: She hands a slip of paper to INDY.
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: I left your father working in the library.
He sent me to the map section to fetch an ancient plan of the city.
When I got back to his table and he'd gone and with all his papers and except for that scrap which I found near his chair.

meta.s: INDY extends the scrap of paper to BRODY.
ELSA leads INDY and BRODY into the large piazza.
People walk about and sit at tables in front of a large building.
They have arrived at the front steps of the library.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: That doesn't look much like a library.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: It looks like a converted church.

meta.s: ELSA leads the way inside.
INDY, BRODY and ELSA enter, their heels CLICKING across the marble floor.
We notice, along with INDY and BRODY, that the library contains many stained- glass windows.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: In this case it's the literal truth.

meta.s: She indicates FOUR HUGE MARBLE COLUMNS that go from floor to ceiling.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: ... were brought back as spoils of war after the sacking of Byzantium during the Crusades.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: INDY glances at the Columns, then notices a Stained-Glass Window that depicts a Knight of the Crusades.
Indy lingers for a moment in front of the window.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: The library's closing in a few moments.
I'll arrange for us to stay a little longer.

meta.s: The minute ELSA is out of earshot.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Marcus and I've seen this window before.

meta.s: INDY whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch he noticed in the airplane.
BRODY glances at the Diary, then at the window and noticing that the Roman numerals in question have been worked into the window's design.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Well, now we know the source of the numbers, but we still don't know what they mean.

meta.s: INDY and BRODY now see ELSA approaching.
Indy quickly tucks the Diary back into his pocket.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (explaining to Brody) My dad sent me this Diary for a reason.
Until we find out why, I suggest we keep it to ourselves.

meta.s: INDY doesn't reply.
He's looking in five directions at once.
His eyes moving across the walls and ceilings and charged with the thrill of discovery.
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: Three, seven and tent That window seems to be the source of the Roman numerals.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: My God, I must be blind

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Dad wasn't looking for a book about the Knight's Tomb... he was looking for the Tomb itself

meta.s: ELSA wears a blank expression.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: The Tomb is somewhere in the library!
You said yourself it used to be a church!

meta.s: INDY's eyes travel up one of the four huge marble columns.
INDY looks again to the stained-glass window.
He points.
INDY has discovered that each Column is numbered with a Roman Numeral.
Indy hurries away toward Column VII.
All BRODY and ELSA can do now is try to keep up with him.
He points again to the stained-glass window.
He looks down to the scrap of paper in his hands.
INDY walks past aisles of book-lined shelves.
He stops, turns, then looks down.
CONTINUED: (3)
He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a LOFT and looks down at BRODY and ELSA.
The floor beneath their feet is an elaborate tile design containing a huge "X" and visible only from this higher angle.
INDY rushes down the staircase and goes to the CENTER TILE where the two sides of the X intersect.
He blows dust away from the tile and tries to pry it up, but cannot.
INDY rushes past BRODY to a cordon held in place by a brass stand underneath the stained-glass window.
INDY raises the brass stand and timing his actions, hits the tile precisely as the Librarian stamps a book.
The Librarian regards the stamper curiously.
INDY continues to pound at the tile as the Librarian resumes his stamping, still puzzled by the SOUND ECHOING through the library.
Finally INDY breaks the tile.
As he bends to remove the pieces of broken tile, a TWO-FOOT SQUARE HOLE IS REVEALED.
Cold air and a wet, rancid smell escape from the hole.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: You're a great deal like your father.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Except he's lost, and I'm not.

meta.s: INDY is impressed with Elsa's spirit, and cooperates agreeably and holding her by the hands and lowering her into the hole.
When her feet finally touch ground below, Indy releases his grip on her and slips the Grail Diary to BRODY.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Look after this for me, will you?

meta.s: Then INDY disappears into the hole.
INDY jumps down a steep step.
He reaches back to help ELSA.
INDY and ELSA glance around.
This is really a horrid place.
Dark and dank.
foul smelling.
Elsa turns.
She removes a cigarette lighter with a unique ivory four-leaf clover design.
INDY and ELSA inspect markings carved onto the walls.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Six hundred years before the Crusades.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: The Christians would have dug their own passages and burial chambers centuries later.

meta.s: INDY takes the lighter from her and lights their way down a dark passageway.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: If there's a Knight of the First Crusade entombed down here, that's where we'll find him.

meta.s: THREE MEN carrying guns make their way down the spiral staircase toward an unsuspecting BRODY.
One of the Men, KAZIM, raises his gun and brings it down hard on Brody's head.
KAZIM gestures with his gun toward the now-unconscious BRODY.
The other two men take Brody's hands and drag him into one of the book-lined aisles.

scene.sceneheader: INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS - DAY

meta.s: DECOMPOSING CORPSES rest in niches carved into the stone walls.
Grotesque skeletal remains with rotting linen stretched across blackened bones.
INDY holds the lighter up as he and ELSA inspect symbols carved into the walls.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: ELSA spots a symbol cut into the wall that she doesn't recognize.
As she blows away some cobwebs:

meta.s: INDY only has to give it a quick glance to know.
INDY holds the lighter up and he and ELSA enter another dark passageway.

dialogue.name: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogue.s: INDY steps to the wall and runs his hand over the stone.
He scrapes the cobwebs away to reveal the ROMAN NUMERAL "X."

meta.s: ELSA now holds the lighter as INDY rams his shoulder into the wall.
The wall collapses on impact and Indy falls through into another room.

dialogue.name: ANOTHER ROOM - THE CATACOMBS
dialogue.s: as INDY falls through the hole in the wall onto rocks surrounded by bubbling, green, slimy liquid.
More skeletons surround him, resting in their carved niches.
ELSA holds the lighter as she peers in at him through the hole in the wall.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I could sink a well down here and retire.

meta.s: INDY reaches up and tears a piece of cloth from one of the skeletons, which breaks apart and falls into the oil-slick water.
INDY uses the scrap of cloth and a bone to fashion a crude torch, which he then dips into the oily water.

dialogue.name: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogue.s: Using the cloth-wrapped bone torch to guide their way, INDY and ELSA come upon a NARROW PASSAGEWAY.
The water is knee-deep and TEEMING WITH RATS.
Thousands of them Crawling on one another's backs.

meta.s: ELSA gasps as the rats scamper between her legs.
INDY moves forward through the rat-infested water as ELSA follows, still gasping in horror.
Suddenly he slips into a hole.
Recovering his balance, he reaches out to Elsa.
She gasps once again, terrified.
INDY lifts her and carries ELSA as he moves forward.

dialogue.name: THE CATACOMBS - THE HOLE IN THE WALL
dialogue.s: KAZIM and his men step to the opening Indy made earlier and shine their flashlights through to the rat-infested water.

dialogue.name: ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogue.s: More rat-infested water as ELSA, now walking again, follows INDY through another passageway lined with skulls and bones.

meta.s: INDY reaches for a wall to steady himself and inadvertently grabs a skeleton.
A bone comes loose in his hand as rats scurry about and leap at him from all directions.
He takes a moment to compose himself, then steps across the water to ELSA's side.
He steps into the water, then reaches up to help Elsa do the same.

dialogue.name: LARGE BURIAL CHAMBER
dialogue.s: The chamber is flooded with black, briny water.

meta.s: In the center of the chamber, jutting up above the water, is what amounts to an "island altar" on which SEVERAL ANCIENT COFFINS rest.
They move toward the altar.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: INDY and ELSA begin to inspect the ornately carved COFFINS like the scholars of antiquity that they are.
These are big oak caskets held together by straps of etched brass.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: It must be one of these...

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: Look at the artistry of these carvings and the scrollwork.

meta.s: One coffin is elevated above the others.
Together they begin to push on the lid and STRAINING and GROANING until it slides away and BANGS against the stone platform.

dialogue.name: INSIDE THE COFFIN
dialogue.s: lie the DECOMPOSED REMAINS of a KNIGHT IN ARMOR.
INDY and ELSA look in...Elsa gasps.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: This is itl we found it!
Look and the engraving on the Shield.
It's the same as on the Grail Tablets The Shield is the Second Marker!

meta.s: INDY unfolds a piece of paper and holds it over the shield.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: It's a rubbing Dad made of the Grail Tablet.

meta.s: The missing portion of the rubbing is completed by the shield.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: Just like your father and giddy as a schoolboy.

meta.s: INDY laughs.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: Wouldn't it be wonderful if he were here now to see this?

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (chuckles) He never would have made it past the rats!
He's scared to death of them!

meta.s: PULL BACK TO REVEAL KAZIM dropping the lighted match into the oil-slick water.

dialogue.name: INDY AND ELSA
dialogue.s: And then he sees the GLOW OF FIRELIGHT dancing across the Catacomb walls.

meta.s: This is followed by THOUSANDS OF RATS FLEEING from around the corner of the Narrow Passageway, STAMPEDING toward ELSA and INDY and SHRIEKING and SQUEALING as they approach.
The rats literally wash over them and like a rodent tidal wave and in their efforts to escape a:

dialogue.name: HUGE ORANGE BALL OF FIRE
dialogue.s: ROARING around the corner hurtling towards them and feeding on the oil slick; consuming the oxygen.

meta.s: ELSA SCREAMS.
INDY braces his back against the altar and TOPPLES THE COFFIN with his feet.
It CRASHES against the stone platform and SPLASHES into the water.
They jump into the water beside the bobbing, overturned coffin.
ELSA hesitates.
INDY literally DUNKS her and pushes her underneath.

dialogue.name: UNDER THE COFFIN
dialogue.s: ELSA surfaces into the air pocket created by the coffin, SPUTTERING and SPITTING.

meta.s: Now INDY pops up into the air pocket.
He looks at ELSA and they are both soaking wet.
CONTINUED:
INDY disappears under the water and swims out from under the coffin.

dialogue.name: UNDER THE WATER
dialogue.s: INDY swims, looking for an escape route.

dialogue.name: UNDER THE COFFIN
dialogue.s: The rats are beginning to force their way inside, swimming through the water and climbing on ELSA, who squirms and screams in terror.

meta.s: INDY pops back up through the water.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I think I've found a way out.

meta.s: ELSA groans.
They take a deep breath and both dive under the water.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. VENICE PIAZZA - OUTDOOR CAFE - DAY

meta.s: The perfect picture postcard and St.
Mark's Square and the Grand Canal beyond.
Cafe customers are startled to see INDY and ELSA climb out of the sewer, wet and smelly.
Indy looks around at the postcard-perfect setting and smiles.
Indy's delight, however, is short-lived since KAZIM and TWO OTHER TURKISH AGENTS are running towards them with drawn guns.
He grabs ELSA by the hand and the two of them run down the dock and LEAP INTO A MOTORBOAT.
INDY fires up the engine and pulls away from the dock... but not before a Turkish Agent JUMPS in with him.
ELSA grabs the wheel and begins to steer the boat while INDY and the Turk trade punches.
Indy's Speedboat BOUNCES across the choppy waters heading in the direction of the DOCKED STEAMSHIP.
KAZIM and his men rush to TWO MORE SPEEDBOATS tied to the dock.
They chase after INDY.
INDY grapples with the Turkish Agent.
As Indy grips his arms, we SEE a GUN in the Agent's hand.
It FIRES.
As INDY fights with the Turk, he becomes aware of the Speedboats behind him and two enormous Freighters ahead of him, joined together by two giant ropes.
INDY, having gained the advantage, leans on top of the Turkish Agent.
ELSA can barely hear INDY over the noise of the motor.
INDY finally delivers the punch that sends the Turkish Agent flying overboard.
Turning, Indy sees that ELSA has committed the speedboat to a course BETWEEN the two Freighters, now being pushed even closer together by a Tugboat.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: I said don't go between them!

meta.s: It's purely academic at this point since the hulls of the the two Freighters loom up on either side of them like cavern walls.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. FULL SHOT - THE HARBOR - DAY

meta.s: One Enemy Speedboat chases INDY between the two Freighters.
But the Speedboat containing KAZIM veers off and goes around.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. BETWEEN THE TWO FREIGHTERS - DAY

meta.s: It's a race for daylight as the two Freighters drift ever closer to one another.
Indy's Speedboat just manages to squeeze through the gap.
But the Enemy Speedboat EXPLODES as it is crushed between the two Freighters, FLYING INTO THE AIR and SPLASHING back down into the water.

dialogue.name: INDY AND ELSA
dialogue.s: spin their boat around in a sharp half-circle to see KAZIM'S SPEEDBOAT appear racing toward them.
He stands in the moving boat, FIRING A MACHINE GUN at INDY and ELSA.

dialogue.name: FULL SHOT - THE HARBOR
dialogue.s: The two boats race across the water nearly side-by-side.
A CHATTERING MACHINE GUN from Kazim's boat SPLINTERS the wood of Indy's boat, until finally the rear of the boat CATCHES ON FIRE.

meta.s: The machine gun runs out of ammunition.
KAZIM puts it down and takes control of the wheel from one of the Turkish Agents in the boat with him.
As Indy's boat drifts toward the GIANT, TURNING PROPELLERS at the STERN of ANOTHER STEAMER, Kazim's boat draws up alongside and hits them.
INDY steps into Kazim's boat.
He knocks one of the Turkish Agents to the deck, then turns his attention to KAZIM.
The two men trade punches as the boat spins helplessly in the churning water.
INDY kicks KAZIM in the face, knocking him into the water, then pulls him back into the boat, now being SUCKED THROUGH THE CHURNING WATER toward the Steamer's giant propeller blades.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Why are you trying to kill us?

dialogue.name: KAZIM
dialogue.s: Because you're looking for the Holy Grail.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: My father was looking for the Holy Grail.

dialogue.name: KAZIM
dialogue.s: If you don't let go, Doctor Jones, we'll both die.

meta.s: CONTINUED:
By now half the boat has been chopped up into matchwood and the blades are getting closer.
The wind of the blades is on their necks.
INDY grabs KAZIM just in time and jumps... into the motorboat, driven by ELSA, which gets alongside in the nick of time.

dialogue.name: KAZIM
dialogue.s: If you let me go, I will tell you where he is.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: And why were you trying to kill me?

dialogue.name: KAZIM
dialogue.s: The secret of the Grail has been safe for a thousand years.
And for all that time the Brotherhood of the Cruciform Sword has been prepared to do anything to keep it safe.

meta.s: KAZIM pulls back his shirt to reveal a birthmark... or is it a tattoo?
Whatever it is, it's a cruciform sword; a Christian cross which tapers down, like the blades of a broadsword.

dialogue.name: KAZIM
dialogue.s: Let me get off at this jetty.

meta.s: The boat is close to the edge of the canal.
INDY gives ELSA a nod, telling her to bring the boat in.
KAZIM steps ashore.
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: KAZIM

Vogel strides purposefully down the hallway.
He BARKS an order, and TWO MORE NAZIS fall into step with him.
INDY grabs his whip, his leather sack and Henry's case from a table.
He hands the case to HENRY and they begin to run.
INDY and HENRY step into an empty room.
HENRY looks horrified by what he's been forced to do as INDY searches frantically for an exit.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: There's got to be a... a secret door around.

meta.s: INDY begins to run his hands over the walls and frantic.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: I find that if I just sit down and think...

meta.s: HENRY sits on a chair which tips back, hitting the wall behind it.
The floor at INDY's feet suddenly begins DROPPING AWAYI INDY grabs a railing to keep from falling, but loses his grip and plunges through the opening which has formed a SPIRAL STAIRCASE.
He rolls down the stairs.
HENRY follows INDY down the staircase.
The stairway deposits Indy and Henry into an enormous WATERY CAVERN beneath the mountain on which the castle was built.
A full-scale Nazi BOAT DOCK has been built inside the cavern.
We see MOTORBOATS, GUNBOATS, SUPPLY BOATS, etc.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: INDY boards one of the motorboats and STARTS THE MOTOR.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Would you say this has been just another typical day for you?

meta.s: HENRY tosses his case at INDY who catches it and angrily throws it back to his father.
INDY moves back to the dock and pushes the boat away.
HENRY looks confused.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: We're not going on the boat?

meta.s: VOGEL and the NAZI SOLDIERS enter the room and spot the spiral staircase leading below.
They quickly descend the stairs.
as VOGEL and the NAZI SOLDIERS rush to the dock.
Vogel sees that a motorboat is missing.
He orders the Nazi Soldiers into a boat.

CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a large box which suddenly BREAKS APART as INDY, now on a motorbike with HENRY in the sidecar, ROARS PAST THE DOCK, hitting TWO NAZI SOLDIERS who scream as they fall into the river.
VOGEL screams after INDY and HENRY as they drive off.
STRAIGHT
INDY looks pleased as he drives the motorbike along the road, but HENRY appears worried.

dialogue.name: FOUR NAZI SOLDIERS ON MOTORCYCLES
dialogue.s: They chase down the road after INDY and HENRY.

meta.s: INDY turns the motorbike down a smaller, dusty tree-lined road.
HENRY gasps as he is jostled about in the sidecar.
One of the NAZI SOLDIERS gives chase along a higher road running in the same direction.
INDY approaches the barricade from one direction as one of the NAZI SOLDIERS approaches from a higher road.
A GUARD steps from the road station and calls to the vehicles as INDY and HENRY SMASH THROUGH THE BARRICADE.
THE NAZI SOLDIER rides his motorcycle through the other side of the barrier-- IT SHATTERS.

dialogue.name: INDY AND HENRY
dialogue.s: INDY grabs at a FLAGPOLE as they roar past and it snaps off in his hand.

meta.s: The NAZI SOLDIER drives his motorcycle toward INDY and HENRY.
He unshoulders his machine gun.
INDY uses the broken flagpole as a lance and knocks the NAZI SOLDIER from his motorcycle.

dialogue.name: THE RIDERLESS MOTORCYCLE
dialogue.s: drives on toward the other NAZI SOLDIERS now approaching the guardhouse, COLLIDING WITH TWO OF THEM.

meta.s: The remaining NAZI SOLDIER maneuvers his motorcycle around his fallen comrades and continues the chase.

dialogue.name: INDY AND HENRY
dialogue.s: As the remaining NAZI SOLDIER rides alongside their motorbike he cocks his gun, preparing to fire.

meta.s: INDY quickly jams the remaining portion of the flagpole through the spokes of the Nazi's front wheel.
The NAZI SOLDIER'S MOTORCYCLE FLIPS THREE TIMES, throwing him high into the air.

dialogue.name: CONTINUED:
dialogue.s: INDY glances back and smiles, but the smile fades as he looks forward again to see a sign at a CROSSROAD.
Arrows pointing in opposite directions indicate the way to BERLIN or VENEDIG.

meta.s: Indy starts down the road marked VENEDIG.
The motorbike skids to a stop.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: We have to get to Berlin!

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: You don't need the Diary, Dad.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: There is more in the Diary than just the map.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: All right Dad and tell me.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Well, he who finds the Grail must face the final challenge.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Three devices of such lethal cunning.

meta.s: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: But I found the clues that will safely take us through, in the Chronicles of St. Anselm.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: I wrote them down in my Diary so that I wouldn't have to remember

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Half the German Army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin?

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: The only thing that matters is the Grail.

meta.s: HENRY slaps him across the face.
INDY is rocked to his foundations, not by any means entirely by the blow itself.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: The quest for the Grail is not archaeology.
If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Unfortunately she kept her illness from me until all I could do was mourn her.

meta.s: Arrows point in opposite directions to VENICE and BERLIN.
The CAMERA MOVES IN on the portion of the sign reading BERLIN.
A Nazi Rally and a book-burning is in process.
The mound of burning books is ten feet tall and growing by the minute as College Students and Nazi Brownshirts continually toss more books onto the fire.
Flags, banners and standards displaying the swastika are waved rhythmically from side to side in a motion that echoes the mounting frenzy of the enormous crowd.
INDY and HENRY walk toward the Square.
Indy wears the uniform of a Nazi Soldier.
He is now buttoning up the tunic and which happens to be several sizes too big.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: My boy, we are Pilgrims in an unholy land.

meta.s: Then... Indy sees something that makes him stop in his tracks.
WE PAN ALONG HIS LINE OF SIGHT to:

dialogue.name: THE PODIUM
dialogue.s: where high-ranking Officers of the Third Reich stand flanking ADOLF HITLER as they oversee the rally.

dialogue.name: ANOTHER ANGLE
dialogue.s: ELSA is walking away in an open area, background of torches, vehicles, Nazi Officers... one of whom is now none other than INDY, coming up to her before she knows he is there.
His voice is quiet and tough, his eyes hard.

meta.s: Still startled, her reaction makes it clear that Indy is even now a lover in her thoughts.
INDY pushes ELSA against a column and begins to search her clothing for the Diary.
He pulls the book from Elsa's pocket.
CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: You came back for the book?

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: My father didn't want it incinerated.

meta.s: She understands him.
It's as though he slapped her.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: Is that what you think of me?
I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (vicious) Yet you stood up to be counted with the enemy of everything the Grail stands for and who gives a damn what you think?

meta.s: Now it's as though she'd slapped him back.
His hands fly to her neck.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: All I have to do is squeeze.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: All I have to do is scream.

meta.s: It's a standoff emotionally.
He knows he'd never do it.
she knows it too.
And the same goes for screaming.
INDY releases her and backs away.
she looks at him with a lover's pain.
He moves over to HENRY.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Let's get the hell out of here.

meta.s: They move off and almost run headlong into HITLER and his entire entourage coming down from the Podium.
50 kids push their autograph books for Hitler's signature.
HITLER pauses to sign them.
Hitler looks Indy's way.
They make eye contact.
It only lasts a moment but the moment is electric.
HITLER breaks the spell by taking the Grail Diary from him, opens it to the first page and signs his autograph.
He hands it back and moves on.
Indy's motorcycle pulls up to the main terminal.
A Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets bearing HENRY'S PICTURE to Nazi Soldiers inside the terminal.
HENRY leans in a doorway reading a newspaper as INDY enters down the stairs and taps Henry's shoulder.
They begin to walk toward the boarding gates.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: The first available flight out of Germany.

meta.s: INDY and HENRY show their papers to the Boarding Guards, then join the line of passengers, which has already begun to move toward a:

dialogue.name: MOORED ZEPPELIN
dialogue.s: Ten stories tall and longer than two football fields: Flying in the grand tradition!

scene.sceneheader: INT. THE ZEPPELIN - PASSENGER COMPARTMENT - DAY

meta.s: The Zeppelin is about to take off.
INDY and HENRY make themselves comfortable in one of the compartments.
HENRY looks over his newspaper at INDY.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: When we're airborne, with Germany behind us, then I'll share that sentiment.

meta.s: But INDY looks out the window and is suddenly concerned when he sees:

dialogue.name: VOGEL AND A GESTAPO AGENT
dialogue.s: rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: sits back in his chair, looks to HENRY, now reading his newspaper.

meta.s: A STEWARD enters and sets a bowl of nuts on the table in front of INDY and HENRY, then continues down the aisle of passengers.
Indy follows after the Steward.
He puts his arm around the Steward's shoulder and together they walk up a flight of stairs.

dialogue.name: VOGEL
dialogue.s: He approaches a MALE PASSENGER hidden behind a newspaper.
VOGEL uses his walking stick to lower the newspaper and show the Passenger the leaflet with Henry's photograph.

meta.s: The Passengers at the table shake their heads in the negative.
VOGEL shows the picture to other Passengers.
VOGEL turns to see:

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: WEARING THE HAT AND JACKET OF THE CHIEF STEWARD.

meta.s: The Passengers do not react to the request, made in English.

dialogue.name: VOGEL
dialogue.s: approaches HENRY, still hidden behind his newspaper.
Again, VOGEL uses his walking stick to lower the paper, revealing Henry's face.

meta.s: Now INDY, still playing the role of Steward, asks VOGEL for his ticket.
HENRY looks confused.
VOGEL glances up and recognizes INDY and who quickly punches Vogel in the face, knocking him toward the window.
In another quick move, Indy TOSSES HIM OUT THE WINDOW onto the tarmac below.
Shocked Passengers blink in bewilderment.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (in German; with a shrug) No ticket.

meta.s: Everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves it in Indy's face.
VOGEL gets to his knees as the huge Zeppelin rises into the sky above him, revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airship.
Vogel shakes his fist at the rising Zeppelin.

dialogue.name: VOGEL
dialogue.s: Du wirst nochmal boren von mir!

meta.s: INDY and HENRY together again in their compartment.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: You know, sharing your adventures is an interesting experience.

meta.s: CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (meaning ELSA) That's not all we shared.
You're old enough to be her fa---er, her grandfather!

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Well, I'm as human as the next man.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: (laughs) Ships that pass in the night...

meta.s: HENRY opens his Diary and begins to thumb through it.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Do you remember the last time we had a quiet drink?

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Hmmm... What did we talk about?

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: And do I detect a rebuke?

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: It was just the two of us, Dad.
It was a lonely way to grow up.
If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Actually, I was a wonderful father.

meta.s: HENRY looks up from his Diary.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Did I ever tell you to eat up?
I respected your privacy and I taught you self- reliance.

meta.s: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: What you taught me was that I was less important to you than people who had been dead for five hundred years in another country.
And I learned it so well that we've hardly spoken for twenty years.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: You left just when you were becoming interesting.

meta.s: He closes the Diary and leans back in his seat.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: What do you want to talk about?

meta.s: INDY stutters uncomfortably as HENRY stares at him, waiting for a response.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Then what are you complaining about?
(laughs) Look, we have work to do.
When we get to Alexandretta we will face three challenges.
(he reads from the Diary) "First, the breath of God.
Only the penitent man will pass.
Second, the Word of God, only in the footsteps of God will he proceed.
Third, the Path of God, only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth. "

meta.s: CONTINUED: (3) Sunlight falls across the table from the window.
INDY reaches for the drink.
The bar of sunlight turns like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the drinks.
We see INDY puzzled.
Only for a moment.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: They're taking us back to Germany.

meta.s: INDY and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin.
The Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed.
INDY and HENRY hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a PAIR OF DOORWAYS framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Well, I thought it would take them a lot longer to figure out the radio was dead.

meta.s: Then INDY opens the doors.
We see plenty of blue sky and white clouds.
We also see a small BIPLANE that is suspended from the Zeppelin by a HOOK & CRANE DEVICE.
INDY climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as HENRY takes the tail gunner's seat.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: (with delight) I didn't know you could fly a plane.

meta.s: INDY turns in his seat to give HENRY the "thumbs up."
Henry smiles valiantly and points down to the ground.
Then they both become aware of a STRANGE SOUND in the skies behind them.
Something between a ROAR and a WAIL.

dialogue.name: TWO MESSERSCHMIDT FIGHTER BOMBERS
dialogue.s: streak out of the clouds and race across the sky.

dialogue.name: INDY AND HENRY
dialogue.s: shrink in their seats as the MESSERSCHMIDTS (going three times as fast as they are) SCREAM past on either side.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Dad, you're gonna have to use the machine gun.

meta.s: HENRY turns and grips the MOUNTED MACHINE GUN with a perplexed expression.
HENRY pulls out his watch.
INDY uses his arm to demonstrate that he's referring to a direction and not a time.
HENRY does and and the EXPLODING GUN nearly shakes him out of his seat.
Indy's slow speed and small size works to his advantage.
The speeding Messerschmidts continually overshoot him, WHIZZING past in a blur and making wide turns miles away in the sky.
HENRY has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight.
He pulls back on the trigger --RATTA-A-TAT-TAT!
RATTA-A-TAT-TAT!
The Messerschmidt banks to the left, but HENRY keeps it in his gun sight.
Henry swings the gun around, inadvertently CUTTING HIS OWN REAR STABILIZER IN HALF.
CONTINUED:
INDY looks back at the missing tail section, then at his father.
The plane begins to go down.
INDY struggles to control its descent.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Hang on, Dads We're going in!

meta.s: HENRY slumps down fearfully in his seat.
The wheels of the plane touch down.
OUT OF CONTROL, the PLANE SKIDS and CRASHES first into a corral of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond sending a cloud of dust into the air.
As INDY pulls himself from the cockpit:
Suddenly, INDY's attention is directed to:
As BULLETS EXPLODE around them, INDY and HENRY jump over a stone barricade.
Henry, frightened, grabs at Indy.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Those people are trying to kill us!

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: It's a new experience for me.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: It happens to me all the time.

meta.s: An OLD MAN kneels at his car repairing a rear tire.

dialogue.name: THE MAN
dialogue.s: turns to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands.
Suddenly the wheel moves forward, startling the Old Man.

meta.s: INDY has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel.
HENRY is a very nervous passenger.
INDY sees a LOW-FLYING MESSERSCHMIDT coming up behind him in the SIDE MIRROR.
As the Messerschmidt ROARS by overhead, BULLET EXPLODE around them, narrowly missing the car.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. THE ROAD - LONG SHOT - DAY

meta.s: The car races toward a TUNNEL that cuts through a steep MOUNTAINSIDE.
The Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car, machine guns CHATTERING.
The car ENTERS the tunnel.
The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time.
It SLAMS into the MOUTH OF THE TUNNEL, SHEARING OFF its WINGS.
The FLAMING FUSELAGE continues to ROCKET through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun.
SPARKS fly as its belly SCRAPES against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel.
Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see this wingless BALL OF FIRE gaining on them; about to overtake them.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. THE ROAD - OTHER SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN - DAY

meta.s: The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road.
The flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and EXPLODES in the middle of the road.
As the car emerges safely from the flames, Henry wipes the sweat from his brow.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Well, they don't come any closer than that!

meta.s: HENRY looks out the windshield and sees the second Messerschmidt SCREAMING out of the sky toward them.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. THE ROAD - LONG SHOT - DAY

meta.s: The MESSERSCHMIDT drops its single UNDER-FUSELAGE BOMB.
It EXPLODES in the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet.

dialogue.name: THE CAR
dialogue.s: FALLS INTO THE HOLE made by the bomb.

meta.s: INDY climbs out of the car, still in the bomb crater.
He turns back to HENRY.
INDY and HENRY run down the mountainside to:

dialogue.name: A DESERTED MEDITERRANEAN BEACH - DAY
dialogue.s: INDY and HENRY run to the shoreline.
Indy reaches for his gun, tucked in his pants.
He opens the chamber and the GUN HAS NO BULLETS.

dialogue.name: THE MESSERSCHMIDT
dialogue.s: swings around and is coming in for another pass.

dialogue.name: INDY AND HENRY
dialogue.s: They don't even think about running: there is no place to run to.
HENRY hands his case to INDY.

meta.s: Holding his umbrella, HENRY suddenly spins around and runs screaming and shouting into A FLOCK OF SEA GULLS...
THE SEA GULLS take to the wing in flight.
Thousands of them.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Bullets kick up sand leading up to him... then and

meta.s: THE MESSERSCHMIDT AND THE SEA GULLS meet in midair.
MASSACRE!
Sea gulls are shredded by the Messerschmidt's whirling propeller blades into a FEATHERY WHITE PUREE that SPLATTERS against the cockpit and CLOGS THE ENGINE.
ENGINE SPUTTERS... STALLS...
Silence.
The Messerschmidt falls from the skies and EXPLODES in an OFF CAMERA SOUND EFFECT.
INDY stands as before and stunned and a statue.
HENRY walks back to INDY.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: "Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky."

meta.s: INDY wears a proud expression as he watches HENRY walk down the beach.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. COURTYARD OF SULTAN'S PALACE - ISKENDERUN - DAY

meta.s: The SULTAN is seated in his royal chair, flanked by WALTER DONOVAN and VOGEL and surrounded by his minions.
DONOVAN holds the missing Grail Diary pages.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: These pages are taken from Professor Jones' diary, Your Highness.
And they include a map that pinpoints the exact location of the Grail.

meta.s: DONOVAN and the SULTAN walk together through an archway.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: As you can see, the Grail is all but in our hands.
(beat) However, Your Highness, we would not think of crossing your soil without your permission, nor of removing the Grail from your borders without suitable compensation.

meta.s: CONTINUED:
TWO NAZI SOLDIERS bring forward a HUGE STEAMER TRUNK.
They open the lid and begin to empty it of its contents: Gold and silver objects of every description.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Precious valuables, Your Highness, "donated" by some of the finest families in all of Germany.

meta.s: The SULTAN gets up from his chair and walks toward the trunk.
He goes right past it and begins to inspect the Nazi staff car parked nearby.

dialogue.name: SULTAN
dialogue.s: 4.3 litre, 30 horsepower, six cylinder engine, with Stromberg Downdraft carburetor.

meta.s: The SULTAN points to the engine under the hood.

dialogue.name: SULTAN
dialogue.s: Can go from zero to 100 kilometres an hour in 12.5 seconds.
And I even like the color.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: (after a beat) The keys are in the ignition, Your Highness.

dialogue.name: SULTAN
dialogue.s: You shall have camels, horses, an armed escort, provisions, desert vehicles and and tanksl

meta.s: Somebody else is also taking note...and we see that it is KAZIM, the spy at the court.
ELSA is revealed coming down the stairs toward DONOVAN and VOGEL.

dialogue.name: ELSA
dialogue.s: We have no time to lose.
Indiana Jones and his father have escaped.

meta.s: SALLAH drives his car through the crowded streets, INDY beside him and HENRY in the back seat.
SALLAH waves his arms and shouts to a CAMEL HERDER.

dialogue.name: SALLAH
dialogue.s: Get that camel out of the way!

dialogue.name: SALLAH
dialogue.s: (overlapping) Ah, they set out across the desert this afternoon.
I believe they took Mister Brody with them.

meta.s: HENRY removes his hat and hits INDY with it.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: And in this sort of race, there's no silver medal for finishing second.

meta.s: Elsa and Donovan's party and consisting of a SUPPLY TRUCK, OPEN CAR, TUhKISH

dialogue.name: SOLDIERS RIDING CAMELS, SPARE HORSES AND A TANK AND VARIOUS OTHER
dialogue.s: VEHICLES and all moving along through the ramble of this box canyon.

meta.s: ELSA, DONOVAN and VOGEL travel in the open car.
The TANK is a vintage World War I model with enormous treads.
The Turkish soldiers wear native dress and carry both carbines and sabers.
BRODY sits alongside ELSA in the rear of the car carrying DONOVAN.
Donovan hands a canteen back to him.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Care to wet your whistle, Marcus?

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: I'd rather spit in your face.
But as I haven't got any spit...

meta.s: VOGEL snatches the canteen away from BRODY before he can drink.

dialogue.name: VOGEL
dialogue.s: We must be within three or four miles.
Otherwise we are off the map.

meta.s: CONTINUED: He hands the map to ELSA, drinks from the canteen, and hands that back to DONOVAN.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: Well, Marcus, we are on the brink of the recovery of the greatest artifact in the history of mankind.

dialogue.name: BRODY
dialogue.s: You're meddling with powers you cannot possibly comprehend.

meta.s: HENRY and SALLAH are at INDY's side as he views Donovan's party in the distance.
Parked nearby is a CAR containing all of their supplies.
Then Donovan notices a reflection from the hills.
What he sees is:
THE SUN REFLECTING OFF THE LENSES OF INDY'S BINOCULARS

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: What do you think you're doing?!

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: Dad, we're well out of range.

meta.s: At that moment the tank FIRES A SHELL in their direction.
It WHISTLES overhead and BLOWS UP THE PARKED CAR.
INDY, HENRY and SALLAH cover their heads as automobile fragments rain down upon them.

dialogue.name: SALLAH
dialogue.s: That car belonged to my brother- in-law.

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: (gesturing to the others) Come on--come on!

dialogue.name: VOGEL
dialogue.s: I can't see anyone up there.

meta.s: CONTINUED:

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: (to VOGEL) Put Brody in the tank.

meta.s: KAZIM peers over a rock, pointing his rifle at the group below.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN
dialogue.s: (to ELSA) Well, in this sun, without transportation, they're as good as dead.

meta.s: BULLETS EXPLODE off the vehicles and cliff.
DONOVAN and ELSA duck.
A NAZI SOLDIER falls from the tank as BULLETS EXPLODE around him.
KAZIM'S MEN, BRETHREN OF THE CRUCIFORM SWORD, continue to FIRE.
ELSA and DONOVAN take cover beside the parked car.

dialogue.name: ANGLE ON INDY'S GROUP
dialogue.s: INDY and HENRY, followed by SALLAH, take cover behind a rock to watch Kazim's Men and the Nazi Troops exchanging fire below them.

dialogue.name: HENRY
dialogue.s: Now, who are all these people?

dialogue.name: INDY
dialogue.s: As long as they're keeping Donovan busy.
Dad, you stay here while Sallah and I organize some transportation.

meta.s: CUT BACK to the action.
The BRETHREN are firing at the DONOVAN party and are being fired on by the Donovan party.
TWO NAZI SOLDIERS throw HAND GRENADES into the cliffs.
They EXPLODE, killing one of Kazim's Brethren.
The battle continues and a fierce exchange of GUNSHOTS, GRENADES and MACHINE GUN FIRE with losses on both sides.

dialogue.name: INDY AND SALLAH
dialogue.s: crouch behind a rock watching as men on both sides of the battle run amongst camels and horses.

dialogue.name: DONOVAN AND ELSA
dialogue.s: They look down at KAZIM who lies mortally wounded on the ground at their feet.

dialogue.name: KAZIM

dialogue.s: Henryl What are you doing here?

That miserable little Diary of yours!

Indy, your father and Brody and

HENRY and BRODY still held at gunpoint by the NAZI SOLDIER.

INDY appears at the entrance, the chain still wrapped about his neck and held by VOGEL.

VOGEL pulls INDY from the tank entrance, yanking on the chain wrapped around his neck.
A NAZI SOLDIER approaches.
INDY hits him, knocking him onto the tank tread.
The Nazi Soldier screams as he is dragged under the rolling tank.
Now INDY and VOGEL struggle with one another, the chain still wrapped around Indy's neck.

dialogue.name: THROUGH THE PERISCOPE

Indy lifts his feet, lunging toward the periscope and pulling Vogel with him.
